Albert DeSalvo.label: Albert DeSalvo
Albert DeSalvo.description: Albert Henry DeSalvo was a criminal in Boston, Massachusetts, who confessed to being the "Boston Strangler", the murderer of thirteen women in the Boston area. DeSalvo was not imprisoned for these murders, however, but for a series of rapes. Wikipedia

Angelo Buono, Jr..label: Angelo Buono, Jr.
Angelo Buono, Jr..description: Angelo Anthony Buono, Jr. was an American serial killer, kidnapper and rapist. Buono and his cousin Kenneth Bianchi together are known as the Hillside Stranglers. Wikipedia
Angelo Buono, Jr..Born: October 5, 1934, Rochester, New York, United States

Amy Archer-Gilligan.label: Amy Archer-Gilligan
Amy Archer-Gilligan.description: "Sister" Amy Duggan Archer-Gilligan was a Windsor, Connecticut, nursing home proprietor and multiple murderer. Wikipedia

Arthur Shawcross.label: Arthur Shawcross
Arthur Shawcross.description: Arthur John Shawcross was an American serial killer, also known as the Genesee River Killer in Rochester, New York. Wikipedia
Arthur Shawcross.Died: November 10, 2008, Albany, New York, United States

Billy Gohl.label: Billy Gohl
Billy Gohl.description: William "Billy" Gohl was an American serial killer who, while working as a union official, murdered sailors passing through Aberdeen, Washington. Wikipedia

Carl Eugene Watts.label: Carl Eugene Watts
Carl Eugene Watts.description: Carl Eugene Watts, also known by his nickname Coral, was an American serial killer dubbed "The Sunday Morning Slasher". Wikipedia
Carl Eugene Watts.Born: November 7, 1953, Fort Hood, Texas, United States

Carol M. Bundy.label: Carol M. Bundy
Carol M. Bundy.description: Carol M. Bundy was an American serial killer. Bundy and Doug Clark became known as "The Sunset Strip Killers" after being convicted of a series of murders in Los Angeles during the late spring and early summer of 1980. Wikipedia

Charles Ray Hatcher.label: Charles Ray Hatcher
Charles Ray Hatcher.description: Charles Ray Hatcher, was an American serial killer who confessed to murdering 16 people between 1969 and 1982. Wikipedia
Charles Ray Hatcher.Born: July 16, 1929, Mound City, Missouri, United States
Charles Ray Hatcher.Died: December 7, 1984, Jefferson City, Missouri, United States

Cincinnati Strangler.label: Cincinnati Strangler
Cincinnati Strangler.description: The Cincinnati Strangler was the name given to a serial killer who raped, then strangled seven mostly elderly women in Cincinnati, Ohio between 1965 and 1966. Wikipedia

Daniel Lee Siebert.label: Daniel Lee Siebert
Daniel Lee Siebert.description: Daniel Lee Siebert was an American serial killer on Alabama's death row. He was convicted of three murders and confessed to at least five. During questioning he indicated that he was responsible for at least 12 deaths. Wikipedia

David Edward Maust.label: David Edward Maust
David Edward Maust.description: David Edward Maust was an American serial killer. Wikipedia
David Edward Maust.Died: January 20, 2006, Crown Point, Indiana, United States

David Meirhofer.label: David Meirhofer
David Meirhofer.description: David G. Meirhofer was an American serial killer who committed four murders in rural Montana between 1967 and 1974 — three of them children. Wikipedia

David Parker Ray.label: David Parker Ray
David Parker Ray.description: David Parker Ray was a suspected American serial killer and known torturer of women. Though no bodies were found, he was accused by his accomplices of killing several people and suspected by police to ... Wikipedia
David Parker Ray.Born: November 6, 1939, Belen, New Mexico, United States

Donald Leroy Evans.label: Donald Leroy Evans
Donald Leroy Evans.description: Donald Leroy Evans was an American serial killer who murdered at least three people from 1985 to 1991. He was known for confessing to killing victims at parks and rest areas across 20 states. Wikipedia

Ernest Ingenito.label: Ernest Ingenito
Ernest Ingenito.description: Ernest "Ernie" Ingenito was an American mass murderer who shot nine people, his wife Theresa Mazzoli and her family, killing five and injuring four, on November 17, 1950 in Franklin Township and Minotola, New Jersey. Wikipedia
Ernest Ingenito.Born: May 27, 1924 (age 89), Wildwood, New Jersey, United States

Ervil LeBaron.label: Ervil LeBaron
Ervil LeBaron.description: Ervil Morrell LeBaron was the leader of a polygamous Mormon fundamentalist group who ordered the killings of many of his opponents, using the religious doctrine of blood atonement to justify the murders. Wikipedia

Gary Ridgway.label: Gary Ridgway
Gary Ridgway.description: Gary Leon Ridgway is an American serial killer known as the Green River Killer. He was initially convicted of 48 separate murders and later confessed to nearly twice that number. Wikipedia
Gary Ridgway.Born: February 18, 1949 (age 65), Salt Lake City, Utah, United States

Gerard John Schaefer.label: Gerard John Schaefer
Gerard John Schaefer.description: Gerard John Schaefer, Jr. was an American murderer and suspected serial killer from Florida. He was imprisoned in 1973 for murders he committed as a Martin County, Florida Sheriff's deputy. Wikipedia
Gerard John Schaefer.Died: December 3, 1995, Florida State Prison, Florida, United States

Glennon Engleman.label: Glennon Engleman
Glennon Engleman.description: Glennon Edward Engleman was a St Louis dentist who moonlighted as a hitman, concocting and carrying out at least seven murders for profit over the course of 30 years. Wikipedia

Jeffrey Dahmer.label: Jeffrey Dahmer
Jeffrey Dahmer.description: Jeffrey Lionel Dahmer, also known as the Milwaukee Cannibal, was an American serial killer and sex offender, who committed the rape, murder and dismemberment of 17 men and boys between 1978 and 1991, ... Wikipedia
Jeffrey Dahmer.Born: May 21, 1960, West Allis, Wisconsin, United States

Jesse Pomeroy.label: Jesse Pomeroy
Jesse Pomeroy.description: Jesse Harding Pomeroy was the youngest person convicted of the crime of murder in the first degree in the history of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Wikipedia
Jesse Pomeroy.Born: November 29, 1859, Charlestown, Boston, Massachusetts, United States

John List.label: John List
John List.description: John Emil List, sometimes labeled the Bogeyman of Westfield, was a convicted multiple murderer and long-time fugitive. Wikipedia
John List.Born: September 17, 1925, Bay City, Michigan, United States
John List.Died: March 21, 2008, Trenton, New Jersey, United States

Joseph C. Palczynski.label: Joseph C. Palczynski
Joseph C. Palczynski.description: Joseph C. "Joe" Palczynski was a spree killer in the suburbs of Baltimore who in March 2000 terrorized residents in the region by killing four people and taking a family of three as hostages in one of the longest one-man standoffs ever known. Wikipedia

Larry Eyler.label: Larry Eyler
Larry Eyler.description: Larry Eyler was an American serial killer convicted and sentenced to death for the 1984 murder and dismemberment of 15-year old Daniel Bridges. He confessed to 21 other homicides of young men and boys in five separate states. Wikipedia

Leslie Irvin (serial killer).label: Leslie Irvin
Leslie Irvin (serial killer).description: Leslie "Mad Dog" Irvin was an American serial killer whose killing spree in the early 1950s terrorized residents of southwestern Indiana and whose Supreme Court case set a precedent for ensuring a fair ... Wikipedia

Mack Ray Edwards.label: Mack Ray Edwards
Mack Ray Edwards.description: Mack Ray Edwards was an American serial killer. He murdered at least six children in Los Angeles County, California between 1953 and 1970. Wikipedia

Maury Travis.label: Maury Travis
Maury Travis.description: Maury Troy Travis was an American serial killer from Ferguson, Missouri, who committed suicide in a St. Louis county jail, after being arrested for murder. Travis was named in a Federal criminal complaint for the murders of two women. Wikipedia

Melvin Rees.label: Melvin Rees
Melvin Rees.description: Melvin Davis Rees was an American serial killer who committed five murders in Virginia and Maryland between 1957 and 1959. Wikipedia

Nannie Doss.label: Nannie Doss
Nannie Doss.description:
Nannie Doss was an American serial killer responsible for the deaths of 11 people between the 1920s and 1954.
She finally confessed to the murders in October 1954, after her fifth husband had died in a small hospital in Tulsa, Oklahoma. Wikipedia
Nannie Doss.Born: November 4, 1905, Blue Mountain, Alabama, United States

Ottis Toole.label: Ottis Toole
Ottis Toole.description: Ottis Elwood Toole was an American who was convicted of six counts of murder and at one time admitted to four more murder charges. However, he recanted and restated a number of confessions during his time in prison. Wikipedia

Paul Durousseau.label: Paul Durousseau
Paul Durousseau.description: Paul Durousseau is an American serial killer who murdered seven young women in the southeast United States between 1997 and 2003. Wikipedia

Richard Biegenwald.label: Richard Biegenwald
Richard Biegenwald.description: Richard Fran Biegenwald was an American serial killer, who committed his crimes in Monmouth County, New Jersey. Between 1958 and 1983, Biegenwald killed at least nine people, and he is suspected in at least two other murders. Wikipedia
Richard Biegenwald.Born: August 24, 1940, Rockland County, New York, United States
Richard Biegenwald.Died: March 10, 2008, Trenton, New Jersey, United States

Richard Chase.label: Richard Chase
Richard Chase.description: Richard Trenton Chase was an American schizophrenic serial killer who killed six people in a span of a month in Sacramento, California. He was nicknamed "The Vampire of Sacramento" because he drank his victims' blood and cannibalized their remains. Wikipedia
Richard Chase.Born: May 23, 1950, Santa Clara County, California, United States

Robert Berdella.label: Robert Berdella
Robert Berdella.description: Robert Andrew "Bob" Berdella was an American serial killer in Kansas City, Missouri who raped, tortured and killed at least six men between 1984 and 1987. Wikipedia
Robert Berdella.Born: January 31, 1949, Cuyahoga Falls, Ohio, United States

Robert Garrow.label: Robert Garrow
Robert Garrow.description: Robert Garrow was an American spree killer who was active in New York in the early 1970s. His criminal trial, known as the Buried Bodies Case, became an important case in legal ethics after his attorneys ... Wikipedia
Robert Garrow.Born: March 4, 1936, Dannemora, New York, United States

Robert Shulman (serial killer).label: Robert Shulman
Robert Shulman (serial killer).description: Robert Shulman was an American serial killer. Shulman, a postal worker from Hicksville, New York on Long Island, was convicted of murdering five prostitutes between 1991 and 1996, the year when he was arrested. Wikipedia

Thor Nis Christiansen.label: Thor Nis Christiansen
Thor Nis Christiansen.description: Thor Nis Christiansen was a serial killer from Solvang, California. He committed his first three murders in late 1976 and early 1977, killing young women of similar appearance from Isla Vista, California. Wikipedia

Timothy McVeigh.label: Timothy McVeigh
Timothy McVeigh.description: Timothy James "Tim" McVeigh was an American who detonated a truck bomb in front of the Alfred P. Murrah Federal Building in Oklahoma City on April 19, 1995. Wikipedia
Timothy McVeigh.Born: April 23, 1968, Lockport, New York, United States
Timothy McVeigh.Died: June 11, 2001, Terre Haute, Indiana, United States

William Richard Bradford.label: William Richard Bradford
William Richard Bradford.description: William Richard "Bill" Bradford was an American murderer who was incarcerated in San Quentin State Prison for the 1984 murders of his 15-year-old neighbor Tracey Campbell and barmaid Shari Miller. Wikipedia

Denis Lortie.label: Denis Lortie
Denis Lortie.description: Denis Lortie is a former Canadian army corporal. In 1984, he stormed into the National Assembly of Quebec building and opened fire with several firearms, killing three Quebec government employees and wounding 13 others. Wikipedia

Friedrich Leibacher.label: Friedrich Leibacher
Friedrich Leibacher.description: Friedrich Heinz Leibacher was a Swiss mass murderer who killed 14 members of the Zug canton Parliament, injuring 18 others, before committing suicide in the Zug massacre. Wikipedia

John Joubert.label: John Joubert
John Joubert.description: John Joseph Joubert IV was an American serial killer convicted of the murders of three boys in Maine and Nebraska. He was executed in Nebraska. Wikipedia

José Luis Calva.label: José Luis Calva
José Luis Calva.description: José Luis Calva Zepeda was a Mexican writer and serial killer. Calva has been accused of murder in up to eight separate cases, all involving women. Calva had also confessed to cannibalism. Wikipedia

Juan Corona.label: Juan Corona
Juan Corona.description:
Juan Vallejo Corona is a Mexican serial killer imprisoned in the United States.
He was convicted of the 1971 murders of 25 itinerant laborers; men who had been found buried in shallow graves in the ... Wikipedia

Mattias Flink.label: Mattias Flink
Mattias Flink.description: Mattias Flink is a Swedish spree killer who killed seven people on June 11, 1994, in Falun, Sweden. He was at the time a second lieutenant in the Swedish Army. Wikipedia

Moses Sithole.label: Moses Sithole
Moses Sithole.description: Moses Sithole is a South African serial killer who committed the "ABC Murders", so named because they began in Atteridgeville, continued in Boksburg and finished in Cleveland, a suburb of Johannesburg. Wikipedia

Colin Norris.label: Colin Norris
Colin Norris.description: Colin Campbell Norris is a former nurse from the Milton area in Glasgow, Scotland who was convicted of murdering four elderly patients in a hospital in Leeds, England, in 2002. He was sentenced in 2008 to serve a minimum of 30 years in prison. Wikipedia

Dorothea Puente.label: Dorothea Puente
Dorothea Puente.description: Dorothea Helen Puente was a convicted American serial killer. In the 1980s, Puente ran a boarding house in Sacramento, California, and cashed the Social Security checks of her elderly and mentally disabled boarders. Wikipedia
Dorothea Puente.Born: January 9, 1929, San Bernardino County, California, United States

Silvo Plut.label: Silvo Plut
Silvo Plut.description: Silvo Plut was a Slovenian serial killer. He was sentenced to 30 years in prison for the murder of Ljubica Ulčar and the attempted murder of her husband Miro Ulčar on February 24, 2006. Wikipedia

Long Island serial killer.label: Long Island serial killer
Long Island serial killer.description: The Long Island Serial Killer is an unidentified suspected serial killer who is believed to have murdered 10 to 14 people associated with the sex trade over a period of 15 years and dumped their bodies ... Wikipedia

Samuel Sidyno.label: Samuel Sidyno
Samuel Sidyno.description: Samuel Sidyno is a South African serial killer who was convicted in 2000 of 7 murders and sentenced to 7 Life Sentences in prison. His victims all came from the Pretoria area of Gauteng. Wikipedia

Sean Vincent Gillis.label: Sean Vincent Gillis
Sean Vincent Gillis.description: Sean Vincent Gillis is an American serial killer that stalked, kidnapped, raped, murdered, and mutilated eight Louisiana women between 1994 and 2003 in the Baton Rouge Metro and surrounding areas. Wikipedia
Sean Vincent Gillis.Born: June 24, 1963 (age 50), Baton Rouge, Louisiana, United States

Akira Nishiguchi.label: Akira Nishiguchi
Akira Nishiguchi.description: Akira Nishiguchi was a Japanese serial killer and fraudster. He is most known for being able to confuse Japanese police into believing that he was only connected to fraud rather than the murders. Wikipedia

Charles Carl Roberts.label: Charles Carl Roberts
Charles Carl Roberts.description: Charles Carl Roberts IV was an American milk truck driver who murdered five Amish girls and injured five others before killing himself in an Amish school in the hamlet of Nickel Mines, in Bart Township, ... Wikipedia
Charles Carl Roberts.Died: October 2, 2006, Bart Township, Pennsylvania, United States

Alexander Spesivtsev.label: Alexander Spesivtsev
Alexander Spesivtsev.description: Alexander Nikolayevich Spesivtsev is a Russian man who was accused of killing up to 80 people and cannibalizing some of his victims. Wikipedia

Daniel Camargo Barbosa.label: Daniel Camargo Barbosa
Daniel Camargo Barbosa.description: Daniel Camargo Barbosa was a Colombian psychopathic serial killer. It is believed that he raped and killed over 150 young girls in Colombia and Ecuador during the 1970s and 1980s. Wikipedia

Luis Garavito.label: Luis Garavito
Luis Garavito.description: Luis Alfredo Garavito Cubillos, a.k.a "La Bestia" or "Tribilín" is a Colombian rapist and serial killer. In 1999, he admitted to the rape and murder of 147 young boys. Wikipedia

Original Night Stalker.label: Original Night Stalker
Original Night Stalker.description: The Original Night Stalker is the name given to an unidentified serial killer and rapist who murdered at least ten people in Southern California from 1979 through 1986. Wikipedia

Pedro López (serial killer).label: Pedro López
Pedro López (serial killer).description: Pedro Alonso López is a Colombian serial killer, accused of raping and killing more than 300 girls across South America. Wikipedia

Stanley Graham.label: Stanley Graham
Stanley Graham.description: Eric Stanley George Graham was a New Zealand mass murderer who killed seven people. Wikipedia

Jerry Brudos.label: Jerry Brudos
Jerry Brudos.description: Jerome Henry "Jerry" Brudos was an American serial killer and necrophiliac, also known as "The Lust Killer" and "The Shoe Fetish Slayer". Wikipedia
Jerry Brudos.Born: January 31, 1939, Webster, South Dakota, United States

Gilbert Paul Jordan.label: Gilbert Paul Jordan
Gilbert Paul Jordan.description: Gilbert Paul Jordan, known as the "Boozing Barber", was a Canadian serial killer who is believed to have committed the so-called "alcohol murders" in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada. Wikipedia

John Martin Crawford.label: John Martin Crawford
John Martin Crawford.description: John Martin Crawford is a Canadian serial killer. Wikipedia

John Wayne Glover.label: John Wayne Glover
John Wayne Glover.description: John Wayne Glover was a British-born Australian serial killer convicted for the murders of six elderly women on Sydney's North Shore. Wikipedia

Larry Gene Ashbrook.label: Larry Gene Ashbrook
Larry Gene Ashbrook.description: Larry Gene Ashbrook was an American mass murderer. On September 15, 1999, he murdered seven people and injured a further seven at a post See You at the Pole Rally featuring a concert by Christian rock ... Wikipedia
Larry Gene Ashbrook.Died: September 15, 1999, Fort Worth, Texas, United States

Bradford murders.label: Bradford murders
Bradford murders.description: The Bradford murders were three serial killings of female sex workers in the city of Bradford, West Yorkshire in 2009 and 2010. Wikipedia

Lisbon Ripper.label: Lisbon Ripper
Lisbon Ripper.description: The Lisbon Ripper was a serial killer who, between 1992 and 1993 murdered three prostitutes in Lisbon, Portugal. Wikipedia

Ronald Dominique.label: Ronald Dominique
Ronald Dominique.description:
Ronald Joseph Dominique is an American serial killer from the Bayou Blue area of Houma, Louisiana.
Dominique was investigated in late 2006 following a police report by a man who refused to let Dominique tie him up. Wikipedia

Cannock Chase murders.label: Cannock Chase murders
Cannock Chase murders.description: The Cannock Chase murders were the murders of three young school girls that occurred in Staffordshire, England, during the late 1960s. Wikipedia

Dámaso Rodríguez Martín.label: Dámaso Rodríguez Martín
Dámaso Rodríguez Martín.description: Dámaso Rodríguez Martín, better known as "El Brujo", was a Spanish serial killer who, in 1991, was responsible for three murders in the Anaga mountain area. Wikipedia

Dale Nelson.label: Dale Nelson
Dale Nelson.description: Dale Merle Nelson was a Canadian mass murderer who killed eight people and partially ate one victim in 1970 following a drinking binge and possible use of LSD. Wikipedia

Elisabeth Wiese.label: Elisabeth Wiese
Elisabeth Wiese.description: Elisabeth Wiese was a German serial killer from Hamburg, convicted and executed for the killing of five children. Wikipedia

Gary Ray Bowles.label: Gary Ray Bowles
Gary Ray Bowles.description: Gary Ray Bowles is an American serial killer who was sentenced to death for the murder of six men. Wikipedia
Gary Ray Bowles.Born: January 25, 1962 (age 52), Clifton Forge, Virginia, United States

Peter Bryan.label: Peter Bryan
Peter Bryan.description: Peter Bryan is an English serial killer and cannibal who committed three murders between 1993 and 2004. Wikipedia

Sophie Charlotte Elisabeth Ursinus.label: Sophie Charlotte Elisabeth Ursinus
Sophie Charlotte Elisabeth Ursinus.description: Sophie Charlotte Elisabeth Ursinus was a German serial killer believed to have been responsible for poisoning her husband, aunt and lover, and of attempting to poison her servant. Her trial led to a method of identifying arsenic poisoning. Wikipedia

Aleksander Laak.label: Aleksander Laak
Aleksander Laak.description:
Aleksander Laak was a lieutenant and the commander of the Jägala concentration camp during the German occupation of Estonia.
The estimates for the number of killed at Jägala concentration camp vary widely. Wikipedia

Donald Neilson.label: Donald Neilson
Donald Neilson.description: Donald Neilson, born Donald Nappey and also known as the "Black Panther", was a British armed robber who murdered multiple people. Wikipedia

Harvey Carignan.label: Harvey Carignan
Harvey Carignan.description: Harvey Louis Carignan is an American serial killer currently serving a 40 year sentence at the Minnesota Correctional Facility – Stillwater for the murders of two women. Wikipedia
Harvey Carignan.Born: May 18, 1927 (age 86), Fargo, North Dakota, United States

Howard Unruh.label: Howard Unruh
Howard Unruh.description: Howard Barton Unruh was an American mass murderer who killed 13 people during a 12-minute walk through his neighborhood on September 6, 1949, in Camden, New Jersey, when he was 28 years old. He died in 2009 after a lengthy illness at the age of 88. Wikipedia
Howard Unruh.Born: January 21, 1921, Camden, New Jersey, United States
Howard Unruh.Died: October 19, 2009, Trenton, New Jersey, United States

Kip Kinkel.label: Kip Kinkel
Kip Kinkel.description: Kipland Philip "Kip" Kinkel is an American spree killer. In May 1998, at the age of 15, he murdered his parents and engaged in a school shooting at Thurston High School in Springfield, Oregon, that left two students dead and 25 others wounded. Wikipedia

Thierry Paulin.label: Thierry Paulin
Thierry Paulin.description: Thierry Paulin was a French serial killer active in the 1980s. Wikipedia

Tony Costa.label: Tony Costa
Tony Costa.description: Antone Charles "Tony" Costa was a Cape Cod, Massachusetts carpenter who achieved notoriety for committing serial murders in and around the town of Truro in 1969. Wikipedia

Alexander Pichushkin.label: Alexander Pichushkin
Alexander Pichushkin.description: Alexander Yuryevich "Sasha" Pichushkin, also known as The Chessboard Killer and The Bitsa Park Maniac, is a Russian serial killer. Wikipedia

Colin Ireland.label: Colin Ireland
Colin Ireland.description:
Colin Ireland was a British serial killer known as the "Gay Slayer" because his victims were homosexual men.
While living in Southend, he started frequenting The Coleherne pub, a gay pub in west London. Wikipedia
Colin Ireland.Died: February 21, 2012, HM Prison Wakefield, United Kingdom

Hastings Arthur Wise.label: Hastings Arthur Wise
Hastings Arthur Wise.description: Hastings Arthur Wise, was a convicted U.S mass murderer who was executed in the U.S. state of South Carolina for killing four former co-workers. Wikipedia
Hastings Arthur Wise.Died: November 4, 2005, Broad River Correctional Institution, Columbia, South Carolina, United States

John Allen Muhammad.label: John Allen Muhammad
John Allen Muhammad.description: John Allen Muhammad was an American convicted murderer from Baton Rouge, Louisiana. He, along with his seventeen-year-old partner, Lee Boyd Malvo, carried out the Beltway sniper attacks of October 2002, killing at least 10 people. Wikipedia
John Allen Muhammad.Born: December 31, 1960, New Orleans, Louisiana, United States

Ramon Salcido.label: Ramon Salcido
Ramon Salcido.description:
Ramón Bojórquez Salcido is a convicted mass murderer and as of 2011 is on death row in California's San Quentin State Prison.
He was convicted of the 1989 knife murders of seven people, including his wife and two of his daughters, Sofía and Teresa. Wikipedia

Christopher Mhlengwa Zikode.label: Christopher Mhlengwa Zikode
Christopher Mhlengwa Zikode.description: Christopher Mhlengwa Zikode is a South African rapist and serial killer who was convicted in 1995 on 8 counts of murder, 5 counts of rape, 5 counts of attempted murder and 2 counts of indecent assault. Wikipedia

Nicholas Lungisa Ncama.label: Nicholas Lungisa Ncama
Nicholas Lungisa Ncama.description: Nicholas Lungisa Ncama is a South African serial killer who was convicted in 1997 of 3 murders and sentenced to life in prison. His victims all came from the Port Elizabeth area of the Eastern Cape. Wikipedia

Norman Afzal Simons.label: Norman Afzal Simons
Norman Afzal Simons.description: Norman Avzal Simons, also known as the "Station Strangler", is a South African rapist and serial killer who was convicted in 1995 on one count of murder and one count of kidnapping Elroy van Rooy, age 10. He was sentenced to 35 years in prison. Wikipedia

Fred West.label: Fred West
Fred West.description: Frederick Walter Stephen West was a serial killer in England. Between 1967 and 1987, West – alone and later with his second wife, serial killer Rosemary West – tortured and raped numerous young women ... Wikipedia
Fred West.Died: January 1, 1995, HM Prison Birmingham, Birmingham, United Kingdom

Guy Georges.label: Guy Georges
Guy Georges.description: Guy Georges is a French serial killer, dubbed "The Beast of the Bastille", who was convicted of murdering seven women between 1991 and 1997. Wikipedia

Harold Shipman.label: Harold Shipman
Harold Shipman.description:
Harold Fredrick Shipman was a British doctor and one of the most prolific serial killers in recorded history by proven murders with up to 250 murders being ascribed to him.
On 31 January 2000, a jury found Shipman guilty of 15 murders. Wikipedia
Harold Shipman.Died: January 13, 2004, HM Prison Wakefield, United Kingdom

Kenneth Erskine.label: Kenneth Erskine
Kenneth Erskine.description: Kenneth Erskine is a British serial killer who became known as the Stockwell Strangler. Wikipedia

Levi Bellfield.label: Levi Bellfield
Levi Bellfield.description: Levi Bellfield is an English serial killer. A former nightclub bouncer and manager of a car clamping business, he was convicted on 25 February 2008 of murdering Marsha McDonnell and Amelie Delagrange. Wikipedia
